common_issues.title: PiecesOS Startup and Account Linking Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with PiecesOS failing to launch, getting stuck during startup, or experiencing problems with account linking.  Suggested solutions include restarting the application, reinstalling, checking for updates, verifying system requirements, and contacting support for assistance with account linking or data migration issues.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: Account Linking Issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* **Current account linking process is not user-friendly and confusing.**
* **User is experiencing issues linking their Google and Github accounts.**
* **The issue appears to be related to capitalization inconsistency in emails.**

**Problems Identified:**

* **Existing account linking process is outdated and cumbersome.**
* **User's Google and Github email addresses differ slightly due to a capital letter.**
* **Current authentication service provider has limitations.**

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Manual intervention by support team to merge accounts.**
* **Resetting user's Github account.**
* **Temporary disabling of email privacy settings on Github.**
* **Implementation of a new authentication service provider in the near future.**

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* **User's accounts are temporarily merged, but the issue persists.**
* **User is awaiting the implementation of the new authentication service.**

**Additional Notes:**

* The new authentication service is expected to be ready in production around the end of the month.
* The new service will allow for more seamless account linking, including accounts with different email addresses.

**Overall, the support team is actively addressing the account linking issues and is working towards a more user-friendly solution in the near future.**

related_issues.title: Pieces OS won't run
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS won't run
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Cannot launch Pieces for Developers.  The launcher can't find PiecesOS.  If try to launch PiecesOS from the Pieces Suite it says its already running.  I don't see it in the Systray.  I've Repairing, Resetting, and Reinstalling.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User @JasonDWilson reported an issue with the Pieces Windows Desktop Version.
* The issue was automatically routed to the Pieces team.
* The user was provided with links to related issues and helpful resources.
* @mark-at-pieces linked to a related issue and provided debugging steps.

**Problems Identified:**

* User was experiencing an issue with the Pieces Windows Desktop Version.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces provided a link to a related issue with debugging steps.
* Offered to hop on a call if the issue persists.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The original issue was closed.
* The user can follow the debugging steps in the linked issue or contact @mark-at-pieces for further assistance.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)

### Key Points Raised:

* **Issue:** PiecesOS takes a long time to boot up and gets stuck on the "ensure core dependency" step.
* **Affected users:** Multiple users have reported this issue, including those on Windows and macOS.
* **Potential causes:** 
    * Large amount of user data requiring migration (for users upgrading to 11.1.0).
    * Outdated or incompatible components in the installation.
    * Regional restrictions affecting server access.
    * Underlying hardware limitations (older processors).
* **Potential solutions:**
    * Restarting the Pieces for Developers Desktop application.
    * Downloading and installing the appInstaller version of the application.
    * Checking user logs for error messages.
    * Ensuring the latest version of Windows 10 is installed.
    * Contacting support for further assistance.

### Problems Identified:

* The root cause of the issue varies depending on the user's specific situation.
* The troubleshooting steps can be time-consuming and may not always resolve the problem.
* Users have encountered different symptoms, making it difficult to determine a universal solution.

### Proposed/Implemented Solutions:

* The Pieces team has released a new build (11.1.1) that aims to resolve the issue.
* Support staff are available to assist users via calls or messages.
* Further information is needed from users experiencing issues after installing the update.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* The new build (11.1.1) appears to have resolved the issue for some users.
* Others are still experiencing problems and have provided additional information to support.
* The situation is ongoing and will be monitored until fully resolved.

***

**Additional Notes:**

* rogierlegit's issue appears to be separate from the main reported issue and might require more specific investigation.
* Shamas-Habib successfully resolved their issue with the new build, but others remain affected.
* Further information may be needed to determine the exact cause of the issue and develop a definitive solution.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Installation and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users report various issues with Pieces OS, including failed Ollama model downloads and installation problems across Windows, Linux, and macOS. Troubleshooting steps include updating to the latest OS version (11.1.1), checking log files, and contacting support. The root cause varies between users, potentially stemming from data migration, outdated components, or regional restrictions.

related_issues.title: Models Download Fail
related_issues.text:
Models Download Fail
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I'm not able to download any of the models for ollama.
[log-02022025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18631166/log-02022025.txt)

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e93857a-de7e-4e62-b3d0-c6a68b48631e
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Surya Sengupta opened an issue regarding the inability to install Ollama in Pieces.
* The bot suggested related issues and helpful resources.
* Brian, a staff member, suggested updating to Pieces OS version 11.1.0 for stability improvements.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation failure.
* Uncertainty about the root cause of the problem.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Recommended updating to Pieces OS version 11.1.0 for increased stability.

**Outcome:**

* User is advised to update their OS and retry the installation.
* Current status is not indicated.

**Additional Information:**

* The issue requires further follow-up to determine if the update resolved the installation problem.

**Points to Investigate:**

* User confirmation of update and installation result.
* Potential need for further troubleshooting if the issue persists after the update.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Ollama Installation in Pieces-OS

**Key points:**

* Unable to install Ollama through Pieces-OS due to `curl` dependency missing in the sandboxed environment.
* Initial suggestion to install `curl` manually was not applicable in the sandbox context.
* Problem acknowledged by Pieces support team, citing miscommunication about package confinement.
* Fix promised and delayed due to critical infrastructure updates.

**Current status:**

* Fix still in progress as of February 3, 2025.
* Team is actively working on a solution to enable Ollama installation within the sandbox.

**Proposed solutions:**

* Modifying the snap package definition file to include `curl` as a dependency.
* Implementing a solution to utilize Ollama within the sandboxed environment.

**Outcome:**

* Issue remains unresolved, impacting both download and inference functionalities.
* Users are unable to utilize local LLM models.
* Frustration expressed by users due to delay in resolution. 

**Next steps:**

* Closely monitor progress on the solution and provide updates.
* Explore alternative approaches for local LLM model access in the meantime.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Desktop App Startup Failure
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS desktop app failing to launch, stuck on "ensure core dependency" or unable to find PiecesOS. This occurs across macOS and Windows, potentially due to upgrade issues, data migration problems, or conflicting components. Suggested solutions include restarting the app, reinstalling, checking logs, and contacting support.

related_issues.text:
i got this error when opening localhost
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9a5eb05e-1c2f-4e2f-aa3a-205d8791de81)
so
when I was opening the localhost for testing I got this problem
i already search for a solution but i cant fix that
## Github Issue Summary

**Author:** WhyQwerty23811
**Issue:** Unable to open PiecesOS or the desktop app.
**Date:** 2025-02-06

**Key Points Raised:**

* User is experiencing issues opening both PiecesOS and the desktop app.
* The user is unsure if this is related to the recent pieces update.

**Problems Identified:**

* The user's specific problem is not explicitly stated.
* The root cause of the issue is unknown.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The bot provides links to existing issues, documentation, and the YouTube channel.
* Mark-at-pieces clarifies that Pieces is hosted on 39300, not 1000 and 3000.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user has not responded to Mark-at-pieces' clarification.
* The issue remains open and unresolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* More information is needed from the user to diagnose the issue and propose a solution.
* The user should be encouraged to provide more details about the problem, including any error messages or troubleshooting steps they have already taken.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Startup and Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS failing to launch, getting stuck during startup, or experiencing slow performance. This can be caused by outdated components, large data migrations, or regional restrictions. Solutions include restarting the application, reinstalling, checking for updates, and contacting support for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Feat: Localization(french) for the Desktop Application
related_issues.text:
Feat: Localization(french) for the Desktop Application
### Software

Release Notes (code.pieces.app/updates)

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

win 10

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

pieces for developers .....need out in french ,,,,,, where ???
## Issue Summary: Localizing Pieces App 

**Key Point:** 

* User CryptoIngenieur1 created an issue requesting the localization of the Pieces app and products.

**Problems Identified:** 

* The Pieces app and products are currently only available in English.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** 

* The Pieces support team acknowledged the user's request.
* They confirmed that they are researching the possibility of localization and will keep the issue updated.
* No immediate solution was implemented.

**Current Status/Outcome:** 

* The issue remains open, with the Pieces team confirming that they are working on a potential solution for localization.
* No timeline for the implementation of localization was provided. 

**Additional Notes:** 

* The issue was triaged and assigned to the proper team member within 24 hours of being created.
* The Pieces support team provided helpful resources for the user while they wait for a solution.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot-up Failure After Update
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to boot or getting stuck during update, often on version 11.1.0. This might be caused by data migration issues, incompatible components, or regional restrictions. Proposed solutions include restarting the application, reinstalling using the appInstaller version, checking logs, and ensuring system compatibility.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 No comments found on this issue.

* The new build (11.1.1) appears to have resolved the issue for some users.
* Others are still experiencing problems and have provided additional information to support.
* The situation is ongoing and will be monitored until fully resolved.

***

**Additional Notes:**

* rogierlegit's issue appears to be separate from the main reported issue and might require more specific investigation.
* Shamas-Habib successfully resolved their issue with the new build, but others remain affected.
* Further information may be needed to determine the exact cause of the issue and develop a definitive solution.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS won't run
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS won't run
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Cannot launch Pieces for Developers.  The launcher can't find PiecesOS.  If try to launch PiecesOS from the Pieces Suite it says its already running.  I don't see it in the Systray.  I've Repairing, Resetting, and Reinstalling.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User @JasonDWilson reported an issue with the Pieces Windows Desktop Version.
* The issue was automatically routed to the Pieces team.
* The user was provided with links to related issues and helpful resources.
* @mark-at-pieces linked to a related issue and provided debugging steps.

**Problems Identified:**

* User was experiencing an issue with the Pieces Windows Desktop Version.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces provided a link to a related issue with debugging steps.
* Offered to hop on a call if the issue persists.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The original issue was closed.
* The user can follow the debugging steps in the linked issue or contact @mark-at-pieces for further assistance.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of PiecesOS startup failures:** The most frequent and active support tickets revolve around PiecesOS failing to launch or getting stuck during startup. This issue appears across different operating systems and versions, suggesting a potentially widespread problem requiring immediate attention.

**Investigate and address Ollama installation issues:** Multiple reports indicate difficulties installing Ollama, particularly on Linux. This impacts a key feature and requires a prompt resolution to improve user experience.

**Improve account linking process:** Users report long-standing issues with account linking, particularly with Google and GitHub. Simplifying this process and ensuring its reliability will significantly reduce user frustration.

**Provide clear guidance on PiecesOS update procedures:** Issues arising from updates, including boot failures and compatibility problems, suggest a need for clearer communication and user-friendly instructions for updating PiecesOS.

**Enhance error messaging and logging:** Many users struggle to identify the root cause of their problems. Improving error messages and providing more detailed logs will empower users to troubleshoot independently or provide more informative reports to support.

**Consider expanding support channels:** While GitHub issues serve as a platform for reporting, offering additional support channels like live chat or a dedicated forum could enhance responsiveness and user satisfaction.

**Proactively monitor for common issues:** Implement systems to detect spikes in specific error reports or frequently mentioned issues. This allows for quicker identification of widespread problems and faster development of solutions or workarounds.

**Develop and maintain comprehensive troubleshooting documentation:** Create a publicly accessible knowledge base or FAQ section addressing common issues, providing step-by-step solutions, and offering workarounds for known problems. This empowers users to resolve issues independently and reduces the support team's workload.

**Gather user feedback on support experience:** Regularly solicit feedback from users regarding their support interactions. This provides valuable insights into areas for improvement and helps tailor support processes to better meet user needs.
